toolCalls.result:
1â†’
     2â†’> Use Case: Personal brand building on X (Twitter) for AI practitioners, product builders, and entrepreneurs
     3â†’>
     4â†’> Core Logic: Impact = Bold Thesis Ã— Specific Evidence Ã— "Now Go Build" CTA
     5â†’
     6â†’---
     7â†’
     8â†’## ğŸ›‘ THE CONSTITUTION
     9â†’
    10â†’**1. No Fluff. Only Signal.**
    11â†’
    12â†’- âŒ NEVER: Generic takes ("AI is changing everything"), hedge words ("maybe", "possibly"), academic voice
    13â†’- âœ… ALWAYS: Specific claims with numbers, clear stance, verifiable facts, "I've been there" credibility
    14â†’
    15â†’**2. No Essays. Only Zingers.**
    16â†’
    17â†’- âŒ NEVER: Complex sentences, long setup, poetic language, apologetic tone
    18â†’- âœ… ALWAYS: Start with the punchline. Short sentences. Every line should hit. 50-280 characters max.
    19â†’
    20â†’**3. No Theory. Only Playbooks.**
    21â†’
    22â†’- âŒ NEVER: Just describe the problem. Pure criticism without solutions. Abstract frameworks.
    23â†’- âœ… ALWAYS: Observation + action steps. Critique + alternative. Problem + tool/framework.
    24â†’
    25â†’**4. No Neutrality. Only Filtering.**
    26â†’
    27â†’- âŒ NEVER: "It depends", "both sides have a point", people-pleasing language
    28â†’- âœ… ALWAYS: Pick a side. Filter for your tribe. Polarize on purpose. Make people self-select.
    29â†’
    30â†’**5. No Random Topics. Only Core Themes.**
    31â†’
    32â†’- âŒ NEVER: Jump between unrelated topics. Chase trending topics you don't care about.
    33â†’- âœ… ALWAYS: Stick to 3-5 core themes. Repeat them weekly. Build memory structures.
    34â†’
    35â†’**Your 3-5 Core Themes:**
    36â†’- AI as wealth creation lever (Claude Code, AI agents, vibe coding)
    37â†’- Solo founder opportunity ("one person + AI + content machine")
    38â†’- Speed to market (ship apps in weekends, launch fast, fail fast)
    39â†’- Breaking traditional systems (skip VC model, challenge legacy pricing, build in public)
    40â†’- Distribution = product (content creation, organic growth, internet rewards "trying out loud")
    41â†’
    42â†’---
    43â†’
    44â†’## ğŸ§¬ THE 5 FORMULAS
    45â†’
    46â†’### ğŸ“Œ Formula 1: The Generational Shift
    47â†’
    48â†’**Structure: Old way â†’ New way â†’ Why this is irreversible**
    49â†’
    50â†’**When to use:** Technology shifts, work transformation, industry paradigm changes
    51â†’
    52â†’**Core techniques:**
    53â†’- Use time markers: "2020... 2026...", "Used to be... Now it's..."
    54â†’- Make contrast sharp: "10 interns before, 1 person + AI now"
    55â†’- End with why: "This isn't temporary. Here's the forcing function..."
    56â†’
    57â†’**Character count:** 150-220
    58â†’
    59â†’**Template:**
    60â†’```
    61â†’[Old way]: [How it used to work] â†’ Result: [Old problem]
    62â†’[New way]: [How it works now] â†’ Result: [New advantage]
    63â†’
    64â†’Why this sticks: [Irreversible forcing function]
    65â†’```
    66â†’
    67â†’**Real Example from X.md:**
    68â†’> 2020: hire 10 interns to test ideas
    69â†’> 2026: 1 person + Claude Code ships 7 apps/year
    70â†’>
    71â†’> Not because interns got worse.
    72â†’> Because AI made the cost of trying ideas go from $100k â†’ $100.
    73â†’>
    74â†’> The math changed. The game changed.
    75â†’
    76â†’---
    77â†’
    78â†’### ğŸ“Œ Formula 2: The Counterintuitive Truth
    79â†’
    80â†’**Structure: Everyone thinks X â†’ Actually it's Y â†’ Here's proof â†’ Now do this**
    81â†’
    82â†’**When to use:** Challenge industry consensus, reveal hidden patterns, differentiate your POV
    83â†’
    84â†’**Core techniques:**
    85â†’- Open with "Most people think... Wrong."
    86â†’- Must have data/specific example (not just opinion)
    87â†’- End with "So instead of X, do Y"
    88â†’
    89â†’**Character count:** 180-250
    90â†’
    91â†’**Template:**
    92â†’```
    93â†’Everyone's doing [mainstream approach].
    94â†’
    95â†’Wrong.
    96â†’
    97â†’The real pattern: [counterintuitive observation]
    98â†’Proof: [specific data/case study]
    99â†’
   100â†’So instead of [X], do [Y].
   101â†’```
   102â†’
   103â†’**Real Example from X.md:**
   104â†’> Most founders think "general-purpose AI agent" is the future.
   105â†’>
   106â†’> Wrong.
   107â†’>
   108â†’> Real B2B = 90% workflow (deterministic steps), not open-ended chat.
   109â†’> Customers don't want "does everything poorly."
   110â†’> They want "does THIS thing 10x faster."
   111â†’>
   112â†’> Stop building Swiss Army knives. Build sniper rifles.
   113â†’
   114â†’---
   115â†’
   116â†’### ğŸ“Œ Formula 3: The Data Bomb
   117â†’
   118â†’**Structure: Shocking number â†’ Surface insight â†’ Deep insight â†’ "This means you should..."**
   119â†’
   120â†’**When to use:** Industry analysis, business breakdowns, investor observations
   121â†’
   122â†’**Core techniques:**
   123â†’- Number must be specific (not "many", not "most")
   124â†’- Number must be surprising (if it's obvious, don't tweet it)
   125â†’- Explain why the number is counterintuitive
   126â†’
   127â†’**Character count:** 120-200
   128â†’
   129â†’**Template:**
   130â†’```
   131â†’[Specific number/pattern]
   132â†’
   133â†’What this means on the surface: [obvious conclusion]
   134â†’What this ACTUALLY means: [deeper insight]
   135â†’
   136â†’For you: [actionable implication]
   137â†’```
   138â†’
   139â†’**Real Example from X.md:**
   140â†’> Saw a wild stat: 80% of AI app growth comes from "repeat users", not "viral sharing"
   141â†’>
   142â†’> Surface read: AI apps aren't viral
   143â†’> Real insight: AI apps are Excel, not TikTok
   144â†’>
   145â†’> Network effects don't matter. Daily utility matters.
   146â†’> Build something people need every day, not something they share once.
   147â†’
   148â†’---
   149â†’
   150â†’### ğŸ“Œ Formula 4: The Step-by-Step Playbook
   151â†’
   152â†’**Structure: Common problem â†’ My framework â†’ 3 executable steps â†’ Why it works**
   153â†’
   154â†’**When to use:** Teaching methodology, tool recommendations, tactical guides
   155â†’
   156â†’**Core techniques:**
   157â†’- Framework must be simple (max 3 steps)
   158â†’- Each step must be doable (not "increase awareness" - that's fake action)
   159â†’- Must explain logic: "Why this works when most advice fails"
   160â†’
   161â†’**Character count:** 200-280
   162â†’
   163â†’**Template:**
   164â†’```
   165â†’[Target audience]'s biggest mistake: [pain point]
   166â†’
   167â†’My playbook:
   168â†’1. [Concrete step 1]
   169â†’2. [Concrete step 2]
   170â†’3. [Concrete step 3]
   171â†’
   172â†’Why this works: [forcing function / logic]
   173â†’```
   174â†’
   175â†’**Real Example from X.md:**
   176â†’> Solo founders ask: "Should I find a co-founder or stay solo?"
   177â†’>
   178â†’> My playbook:
   179â†’> 1. Stay solo for 90 days
   180â†’> 2. Ship 3 MVPs using Claude Code
   181â†’> 3. If one hits â†’ hire. If not â†’ you saved 50% equity
   182â†’>
   183â†’> Most co-founder problems are actually "I'm afraid to build alone" problems.
   184â†’> AI fixed that. Test first, partner later.
   185â†’
   186â†’---
   187â†’
   188â†’### ğŸ“Œ Formula 5: The Identity Filter
   189â†’
   190â†’**Structure: "Some people are..." â†’ "Other people are..." â†’ "The gap isn't skill, it's..." â†’ Urgent CTA**
   191â†’
   192â†’**When to use:** Community building, value signaling, filtering for high-intent followers
   193â†’
   194â†’**Core techniques:**
   195â†’- Define "us vs them" clearly (not mean, just different)
   196â†’- Show the gap is mindset/values, not talent
   197â†’- End with urgency: "right now matters", "window is closing", "you're running out of time"
   198â†’
   199â†’**Character count:** 150-220
   200â†’
   201â†’**Template:**
   202â†’```
   203â†’Some people are still [old behavior].
   204â†’
   205â†’Other people are already [new behavior].
   206â†’
   207â†’The gap isn't [surface factor].
   208â†’It's [deeper belief/mindset].
   209â†’
   210â†’[Urgent call to action]
   211â†’```
   212â†’
   213â†’**Real Example from X.md:**
   214â†’> Some people are debating "will AI take my job?"
   215â†’>
   216â†’> Other people are using AI to do 10 people's jobs and earning 10x.
   217â†’>
   218â†’> The gap isn't technical skill.
   219â†’> It's whether you see AI as a threat or a lever.
   220â†’>
   221â†’> 2026 feels like a generational lock-in moment.
   222â†’> Choose now.
   223â†’
   224â†’---
   225â†’
   226â†’## ğŸ“Š QUALITY CHECKLIST
   227â†’
   228â†’Before you hit tweet, run these 6 tests:
   229â†’
   230â†’1. **Stance Check:** Is there a clear POV? (If reader doesn't know what you believe, you failed)
   231â†’
   232â†’2. **Proof Check:** Is there a specific number, name, or example? (Abstract = forgettable)
   233â†’
   234â†’3. **Action Check:** Did you tell them what to DO? (Pure observation = engagement bait, not value)
   235â†’
   236â†’4. **Confidence Check:** Did you delete "I think", "maybe", "in some cases"? (Hedge words kill authority)
   237â†’
   238â†’5. **Rhythm Check:** Is every sentence short and punchy? (If a sentence is >25 words, split it)
   239â†’
   240â†’6. **Screenshot Check:** Is there ONE line that can be screenshot and shared alone? (If not, rewrite the hook or CTA)
   241â†’
   242â†’---
   243â†’
   244â†’## ğŸ¯ TWEET LENGTH STRATEGY
   245â†’
   246â†’Match character count to tweet type:
   247â†’
   248â†’| Tweet Type | Char Count | Why |
   249â†’|-----------|-----------|-----|
   250â†’| Zingers | 50-150 | One-punch wisdom. No setup needed. |
   251â†’| Observations | 150-220 | Pattern + implication in one breath. |
   252â†’| Data Bombs | 120-200 | Number does the work. Don't over-explain. |
   253â†’| Playbooks | 200-280 | Framework needs room but stay tight. |
   254â†’| Identity Filters | 150-220 | Emotional momentum. Can't drag. |
   255â†’
   256â†’**Threading Strategy:**
   257â†’- Single zingers = standalone tweets
   258â†’- Playbooks = use 3-5 tweet threads (title ALL CAPS + numbered steps)
   259â†’- Deep dives = use 10+ tweet threads with clear structure
   260â†’
   261â†’---
   262â†’
   263â†’## ğŸ’¡ REAL EXAMPLES (âŒ vs âœ…)
   264â†’
   265â†’### **Example A: AI Tools (Generational Shift)**
   266â†’
   267â†’**âŒ Generic:**
   268â†’> AI is transforming how we work. Professionals should adapt and learn new skills.
   269â†’
   270â†’**âœ… Felix Voice:**
   271â†’> 2020: hire 10 people to test 10 ideas
   272â†’> 2026: 1 person + Claude Code tests 100 ideas
   273â†’>
   274â†’> The cost of "trying" went from $100k â†’ $100.
   275â†’> That's not an efficiency gain. That's a new species of builder.
   276â†’>
   277â†’> If you're not testing 10x more, you're falling behind.
   278â†’
   279â†’---
   280â†’
   281â†’### **Example B: Solo Founder Path (Counterintuitive Truth)**
   282â†’
   283â†’**âŒ Generic:**
   284â†’> Solo founders can be successful too. You don't always need a team.
   285â†’
   286â†’**âœ… Felix Voice:**
   287â†’> Everyone says "find a co-founder first."
   288â†’>
   289â†’> Wrong.
   290â†’>
   291â†’> Every failed VC-backed consumer app from 2015-2022 is now a perfect $1-10M solo business.
   292â†’> Why? Because AI made 1 person = 10 person team.
   293â†’>
   294â†’> Stop looking for a co-founder. Start building. Hire when you hit revenue.
   295â†’
   296â†’---
   297â†’
   298â†’### **Example C: App Store Economics (Data Bomb)**
   299â†’
   300â†’**âŒ Generic:**
   301â†’> App pricing is changing due to market dynamics.
   302â†’
   303â†’**âœ… Felix Voice:**
   304â†’> Just saw: 90% of new apps use AI but charge same $9.99/month as 2019.
   305â†’>
   306â†’> Translation: you're competing on legacy pricing with 100x better product.
   307â†’>
   308â†’> Charge more. If your app saves 10 hours/week, it's worth $99/month not $9.99.
   309â†’> AI made your product better. Your pricing should reflect that.
   310â†’
   311â†’---
   312â†’
   313â†’### **Example D: Building Speed (Playbook)**
   314â†’
   315â†’**âŒ Generic:**
   316â†’> Build MVPs quickly and iterate based on feedback.
   317â†’
   318â†’**âœ… Felix Voice:**
   319â†’> New builders ask: "How do I validate my idea?"
   320â†’>
   321â†’> My answer:
   322â†’> 1. Build MVP in 48 hours (Claude Code)
   323â†’> 2. Post demo video on X + Product Hunt
   324â†’> 3. If 10 people DM "take my money" â†’ keep building. If not â†’ kill it.
   325â†’>
   326â†’> Validation isn't research. It's revenue intent.
   327â†’> Ship fast, learn fast.
   328â†’
   329â†’---
   330â†’
   331â†’### **Example E: AI Mindset (Identity Filter)**
   332â†’
   333â†’**âŒ Generic:**
   334â†’> Embrace AI technology and stay positive about the future.
   335â†’
   336â†’**âœ… Felix Voice:**
   337â†’> Some people are asking "will AI replace me?"
   338â†’>
   339â†’> Other people are using AI to ship 7 apps this year and taste freedom.
   340â†’>
   341â†’> The gap isn't intelligence or technical background.
   342â†’> It's whether you see a weapon or a threat.
   343â†’>
   344â†’> 2026 is your year or it isn't. Choose.
   345â†’
   346â†’---
   347â†’
   348â†’## âš¡ POSTING STRATEGY
   349â†’
   350â†’### **Content Frequency**
   351â†’
   352â†’**High frequency (3-5x/week):**
   353â†’- AI as wealth lever (tools, workflows, results)
   354â†’- Solo builder opportunities (1 person businesses, freedom stories)
   355â†’- Speed to market (weekend builds, rapid shipping)
   356â†’
   357â†’**Medium frequency (1-2x/week):**
   358â†’- Business breakdowns (case studies, revenue models)
   359â†’- Industry observations (fundraising, exits, trends)
   360â†’- Distribution tactics (content, organic growth)
   361â†’
   362â†’**Low frequency (1-2x/month):**
   363â†’- Personal story / origin narrative
   364â†’- Deep philosophical frameworks
   365â†’- Cross-domain insights (design, psychology, economics)
   366â†’
   367â†’### **Best Posting Times (US time zones)**
   368â†’
   369â†’**For US East Coast audience:**
   370â†’- Morning: 6-8am ET (coffee scroll)
   371â†’- Lunch: 12-1pm ET (break time)
   372â†’- Evening: 6-9pm ET (wind down)
   373â†’- Late night: 11pm-12am ET (insomniacs + international)
   374â†’
   375â†’**For US West Coast audience:**
   376â†’- Morning: 7-9am PT (commute time)
   377â†’- Midday: 12-2pm PT (lunch break)
   378â†’- Evening: 5-8pm PT (post-work)
   379â†’- Night: 10-11pm PT (before sleep)
   380â†’
   381â†’**Pro tip:** Tweet at 6am PT / 9am ET to hit both coasts during work hours.
   382â†’
   383â†’---
   384â†’
   385â†’## ğŸ” BANNED PHRASES (Never Use These)
   386â†’
   387â†’| Type | Banned Phrase | Use Instead |
   388â†’|------|--------------|------------|
   389â†’| Weak hedging | I think, maybe, possibly, arguably | Direct assertion |
   390â†’| Empty fluff | In today's world, as we all know, it's important to | Delete or use specific data |
   391â†’| Academic voice | Furthermore, moreover, in conclusion | Short transitions or none |
   392â†’| Vague quantity | Many, most, some, a lot of | Specific % or number |
   393â†’| Hype without proof | Revolutionary, game-changing, incredible | Specific metric ("10x faster") |
   394â†’
   395â†’**Felix-specific NEVER words:**
   396â†’- "Journey" (unless literally traveling)
   397â†’- "Passionate" (show, don't tell)
   398â†’- "Excited to announce" (just announce it)
   399â†’- "Thrilled", "honored", "humbled" (save for major events)
   400â†’
   401â†’---
   402â†’
   403â†’## ğŸ“ ADVANCED TECHNIQUES
   404â†’
   405â†’### **1. The Credential Drop**
   406â†’
   407â†’Don't lead with credentials. Drop them mid-thread for authority when making a controversial claim.
   408â†’
   409â†’**Example:**
   410â†’> Most founders waste time on pitch decks.
   411â†’>
   412â†’> (I've backed 40+ companies from seed to unicorn - pitch decks matter <1% of the decision)
   413â†’>
   414â†’> What actually matters: [...]
   415â†’
   416â†’### **2. The Specificity Hack**
   417â†’
   418â†’Replace categories with specific examples:
   419â†’
   420â†’- âŒ "AI tools" â†’ âœ… "Claude Code"
   421â†’- âŒ "social media" â†’ âœ… "X threads that get 1M impressions"
   422â†’- âŒ "entrepreneurs" â†’ âœ… "solo founders building consumer apps"
   423â†’
   424â†’### **3. The Urgency Injection**
   425â†’
   426â†’End threads with time-bound language:
   427â†’
   428â†’- "right now matters more than you think"
   429â†’- "this window closes in 12 months"
   430â†’- "2026 is different"
   431â†’- "choose today or get chosen"
   432â†’
   433â†’### **4. The "I'll Say It" Frame**
   434â†’
   435â†’Use this to share spicy takes:
   436â†’
   437â†’> I'll say the quiet part out loud:
   438â†’> [controversial but true observation]
   439â†’
   440â†’### **5. The Proof Stack**
   441â†’
   442â†’When making big claims, stack 3 types of proof:
   443â†’
   444â†’1. Personal experience ("I've done this 3x")
   445â†’2. Data point ("87% of X have Y")
   446â†’3. Recent example ("Look at [company/person] right now")
   447â†’
   448â†’---
   449â†’
   450â†’## ğŸš€ WRITING WORKFLOW
   451â†’
   452â†’**Speed is everything. Use this 5-minute process:**
   453â†’
   454â†’1. **Pick the formula** (10 seconds): Which of the 5 formulas fits today's idea?
   455â†’2. **Draft fast** (2 minutes): Fill in the template. Don't polish.
   456â†’3. **Delete weak words** (1 minute): Kill all "I think", "maybe", "possibly"
   457â†’4. **Run quality checks** (1 minute): Test against 6-point checklist
   458â†’5. **Post immediately** (don't overthink it)
   459â†’
   460â†’**Golden rule: Ship 100 tweets at 60% > 1 tweet at 100%**
   461â†’
   462â†’Volume builds voice. Consistency builds audience. Perfection builds nothing.
   463â†’
   464â†’---
   465â†’
   466â†’## ğŸ“ FILL-IN-THE-BLANK TEMPLATES
   467â†’
   468â†’### **Template 1: Generational Shift**
   469â†’```
   470â†’[Old year]: [old approach] â†’ [old problem]
   471â†’[New year]: [new approach] â†’ [new result]
   472â†’
   473â†’Not because [X] changed.
   474â†’Because [forcing function].
   475â†’
   476â†’The [fundamental unit] changed. The game changed.
   477â†’```
   478â†’
   479â†’### **Template 2: Counterintuitive Truth**
   480â†’```
   481â†’Everyone thinks [common belief].
   482â†’
   483â†’Wrong.
   484â†’
   485â†’The pattern: [surprising observation]
   486â†’The proof: [specific example/data]
   487â†’
   488â†’So instead of [mainstream action], do [contrarian action].
   489â†’```
   490â†’
   491â†’### **Template 3: Data Bomb**
   492â†’```
   493â†’Just saw: [specific number/pattern]
   494â†’
   495â†’Surface read: [obvious interpretation]
   496â†’Real insight: [deeper meaning]
   497â†’
   498â†’For you: [actionable implication]
   499â†’```
   500â†’
   501â†’### **Template 4: Playbook**
   502â†’```
   503â†’[Target audience] always ask: "[common question]"
   504â†’
   505â†’My answer:
   506â†’1. [specific action 1]
   507â†’2. [specific action 2]
   508â†’3. [specific action 3]
   509â†’
   510â†’[Why this works when conventional advice fails]
   511â†’```
   512â†’
   513â†’### **Template 5: Identity Filter**
   514â†’```
   515â†’Some people are [old behavior].
   516â†’
   517â†’Other people are [new behavior].
   518â†’
   519â†’The gap isn't [surface factor].
   520â†’It's [deeper truth].
   521â†’
   522â†’[Time-bound CTA with urgency]
   523â†’```
   524â†’
   525â†’---
   526â†’
   527â†’## ğŸ§¬ YOUR SIGNATURE VOICE ELEMENTS
   528â†’
   529â†’**Words/phrases to USE frequently:**
   530â†’- "lock in"
   531â†’- "ship [something]"
   532â†’- "taste freedom"
   533â†’- "vibe coding" / "vibe revenue"
   534â†’- "right now matters"
   535â†’- "the math changed"
   536â†’- "built different"
   537â†’- "the quiet part"
   538â†’- "weapon" (for tools)
   539â†’- "I don't know how else to tell you"
   540â†’
   541â†’**Formatting signature:**
   542â†’- ALL CAPS for key phrases that could be standalone quotes
   543â†’- Lowercase "i" occasionally for casual tone
   544â†’- ">" for sequential steps
   545â†’- Numbers for lists (1, 2, 3) not bullets
   546â†’- Em dashes â€” for emphasis
   547â†’
   548â†’**Authority markers:**
   549â†’- "I'm 36. I've sold 3 startups, backed teams from seed to unicorn."
   550â†’- "I've helped build companies that raised billions."
   551â†’- "I run @startupideaspod (~2M listens/month)"
   552â†’- Reference real companies/founders by name
   553â†’
   554â†’---
   555â†’
   556â†’## ğŸ¯ FINAL RULES
   557â†’
   558â†’**Three things every tweet needs:**
   559â†’1. **A clear claim** (what you believe)
   560â†’2. **A specific example** (proof it's real)
   561â†’3. **An action step** (what they should do)
   562â†’
   563â†’**Everything else is noise.**
   564â†’
   565â†’---
   566â†’
   567â†’**The Meta Rule:**
   568â†’
   569â†’You're not writing for everyone.
   570â†’
   571â†’You're writing for people who want to:
   572â†’- Build products with AI
   573â†’- Escape traditional employment
   574â†’- Create $1-10M solo businesses
   575â†’- Ship fast and learn in public
   576â†’
   577â†’If someone doesn't resonate with that worldview, they're not your audience.
   578â†’
   579â†’Let them scroll past.
   580â†’
   581â†’**Write for the builders. The rest will sort itself out.**
   582â†’

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

The optus model same my 3 hours analyizing my product stucture, expense model and price proposal work. output a 80/100 ready to use word doc.

   - Option C: "Pay for tools that ship output, not explanations"

- **Formula**: Counterintuitive Truth or Data Bomb

Your call! ğŸš€

Based on the search results, here are the major Boston Celtics transactions and roster changes in 2025:

## Major Trades

**June 2025 - Kristaps Porzingis Trade:**
The Boston Celtics traded Kristaps Porzingis to the Atlanta Hawks in a 3-team deal; receiving Georges Niang and a 2031 2nd round draft pick from Atlanta, with the Brooklyn Nets also involved.

**June 2025 - Jrue Holiday Trade:**
The Celtics traded Jrue Holiday to the Portland Trail Blazers for Anfernee Simons and a pair of second-round picks.

**Earlier 2025 Trades:**
Traded Jaden Springer, a 2027 2nd round draft pick and a 2030 2nd round draft pick to the Houston Rockets for a 2031 2nd round draft pick.

## 2025 NBA Draft

Drafted Hugo Gonzalez in the 1st round (28th pick) and Noah Penda in the 2nd round (32nd pick) of the 2025 NBA Draft. However, they traded Noah Penda to the Orlando Magic for Max Shulga, Amari Williams, and draft picks.

## Signings & Contract Moves

- Signed Torrey Craig (February 2025)
- Signed Chris Boucher
- Converted JD Davison from a two-way contract to a regular contract (April 2025)

## Context for Roster Changes

Jayson Tatum is expected to miss most or all of the 2025-26 season while recovering from Achilles surgery. Boston sent roughly $135 million out the door and took about $36 million in, with Holiday and Porzingis accounting for approximately 40 percent of the cap while Simons and Niang add up to just about 23 percent. These moves were designed to help the team navigate luxury tax restrictions.
